channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Stocks fall in volatile trading, extending Thursday’s sell-off
item.description: The moves came after stocks sold off sharply in Thursday's regular session.

item.title: 'We see a big recession in the making': Top CEOs are fearing the worst in Europe
item.description: The CEOs of several European blue chip companies have told CNBC that they see a significant recession coming down the pike in Europe.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Conservatives suffer losses in UK local elections, amid scandal and cost-of-living crisis
item.description: The U.K.'s ruling Conservative Party has lost a slew of seats in local elections across England, dealing a potential blow to embattled Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

item.title: Elon Musk denies claim by Truth Social boss that Trump encouraged him to buy Twitter
item.description: Devin Nunes, head of Donald Trump's social media company, told Fox Business News that the ex-president urged Tesla chief Elon Musk to buy Twitter.

item.title: European stocks close 1.6% lower as investors fret over rate hikes, surging inflation
item.description: European markets retreated on Friday, tracking global caution after Wall Street posted its worst day since 2020.

item.title: CDC investigating 109 cases of severe hepatitis in children across 25 states and territories, including 5 deaths
item.description: The cases of severe hepatitis are across 25 states and territories.

item.title: Ice cream freezers to get 'warmed up' in trial by Ben & Jerry's owner
item.description: The company is eyeing pilot schemes in Germany and Indonesia.

item.title: All-out war on Ukraine? Putin could be gearing up for something big on May 9
item.description: "Victory Day" is a key day for Russia as it marks the anniversary of the then-Soviet Union's defeat of Nazi Germany.

item.title: Payroll growth accelerated by 428,000 in April, more than expected as jobs picture stays strong
item.description: Nonfarm payrolls grew by 428,000 for the month, a bit above the Dow Jones estimate of 400,000. The unemployment rate was 3.6%.

item.title: Nvidia didn't tell investors enough about effects of crypto mining on its business, SEC says
item.description: In 2017, ETH rose from $10 to $800, driving demand for Nvidia graphics cards.

item.title: Scientists are hoping to grow coral reefs at the base of wind turbines in Taiwan
item.description: The planet's reefs face a number of threats, including coral bleaching.

item.title: Bitcoin drops below $36,000 amid broader market sell-off
item.description: Bitcoin cratered on Thursday as a major stock sell-off in the U.S. spooked the cryptocurrency market.

item.title: Used-car prices are down from record highs, easing the impact of inflation
item.description: Wholesale vehicle prices have dropped 6.4% since the January record.

item.title: How a trip to rural Zambia, backed by U2 singer Bono, led Matt Damon to campaign for clean water
item.description: The Oscar-winning actor, producer and screenwriter co-founded nonprofit Water.org in 2009.

item.title: ECB member pushes for quick move to raise rates, says Russia-Ukraine war could derail recovery
item.description: The European Central Bank should move quickly to raise interest rates in order to tackle soaring inflation, according to Finland's central bank chief.

item.title: U.S.-listed Chinese EV maker Nio proposes a secondary listing of its shares in Singapore
item.description: The move comes as Nio and dozens of other U.S.-listed Chinese companies face a possible delisting from American exchanges.

item.title: China's Xi urges officials to 'resolutely fight' those who question zero-Covid policy
item.description: Xi Jinping led a meeting stressing that China should stick to its zero-Covid policy and warned of the economic consequences of not doing so, state media said.

item.title: Bank of England chief defends cautious rate hiking cycle, sees unprecedented shock to people's income
item.description: The BOE is tasked with steering the economy through an inflation surge that has been exacerbated by Russia's unprovoked onslaught in Ukraine.

item.title: Hong Kong's Hang Seng index drops more than 3% following Wall Street tumble
item.description: Shares on Wall Street declined sharply overnight, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average seeing its worst day since 2020.

item.title: China's Covid lockdowns are hitting more than just Shanghai and Beijing
item.description: While the bulk of China's new Covid cases are in Shanghai and Beijing, data show the impact of business restrictions is more widespread.

item.title: As the Philippine election draws near, China-friendly Marcos still retains a wide lead
item.description: With just days to go before the Philippine elections, Ferdinand Marcos Jr. continues to retain a big lead over his closest rival — the country's current Vice President Leni Robredo.

item.title: Longtime China bull Stephen Roach says there's 'no way' Beijing will meet its 5.5% growth target
item.description: Beijing has officially set a growth target of around 5.5% for the Chinese economy this year, but economist Stephen Roach says "it will be lucky if it makes 4."

item.title: Tech sell-off pushes Nasdaq to steepest drop since June 2020
item.description: E-commerce and cloud stocks led the decline in technology, which was hit particularly hard after the Federal Reserve raised its benchmark interest rate.

item.title: Facebook caused chaos to put pressure on Australian lawmakers, report says
item.description: The report details actions Facebook took ahead of new legislation that would make digital platforms like Facebook and Google pay for news.

item.title: Fiji seizes $300 million superyacht belonging to Russian oligarch Suleiman Kerimov
item.description: The seizure of Suleiman Kerimov's superyacht is part of a broader effort to take the assets of sanctioned oligarchs as Russia invades Ukraine.

item.title: Elon Musk and Cathie Wood knock passive index investing, saying it’s gone too far
item.description: Elon Musk and Cathie Wood took aim at index funds, arguing that passive investments have controlled too big a percentage of the stock market.

item.title: F1 CEO sees 'great opportunity' in TV rights talks with ESPN deal due to expire
item.description: The racing league's current deal with ESPN expires at the end of 2022.

item.title: 'Unretirement' is becoming a hot new trend in the sizzling U.S. labor market
item.description: The level of workers who retired then came back a year later is running around 3.2%, just about where it was before the pandemic.

item.title: India's high inflation will likely persist despite surprise rate hike, says economist
item.description: The Reserve Bank of India on Wednesday surprised markets by raising the key borrowing rate for the first time in nearly four years.

item.title: World’s second-largest hydropower plant set for 14-year upgrade after deal with GE
item.description: Itaipu commenced electricity production in 1984.
